channel.title: Here We Are
channel.description: Join comedian Shane Mauss as he interviews science experts across the country in a journey to find out what makes us who we are.
channel.itunes:summary: Join comedian Shane Mauss as he interviews science experts across the country in a journey to find out what makes us who we are.
channel.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: 166: Neuroscience + Parkinson's
item.itunes:title: Neuroscience + Parkinson's
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description:
Shane dives into the weeds talking with OHSU Grad. Student Rebecca Hood about behavioral neuroscience, Parkinson’s disease, and the resilience of mice. Charity of The Week – World Parkinson’s Coalition.
Outro music by The Long Hunt
item.itunes:subtitle:
Shane dives into the weeds talking with OHSU Grad. Student Rebecca Hood about behavioral neuroscience, Parkinson’s disease, and the resilience of mice. Charity of The Week – World Parkinson’s Coalition.
Outro music by The Long Hunt
item.itunes:summary:
Shane dives into the weeds talking with OHSU Grad. Student Rebecca Hood about behavioral neuroscience, Parkinson’s disease, and the resilience of mice. Charity of The Week – World Parkinson’s Coalition.
Outro music by The Long Hunt
item.content:encoded:
Shane dives into the weeds talking with OHSU Grad. Student Rebecca Hood about behavioral neuroscience, Parkinson’s disease, and the resilience of mice. Charity of The Week – World Parkinson’s Coalition.

Outro music by The Long Hunt
item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: 165: MycoMeditations #2
item.itunes:title: MycoMeditations #2
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane sits down with the facilitators of the recent Here We Are-MycoMeditations psylocybin retreat in Jamaica. They discussed the highlights, talked about how it went, and shared their afterthoughts.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane sits down with the facilitators of the recent Here We Are-MycoMeditations psylocybin retreat in Jamaica. They discussed the highlights, talked about how it went, and shared their afterthoughts.

item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: 164: Religion + Racism
item.itunes:title: Religion + Racism
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description:
Shane talks with Professor of religion, and author of “Raising White Kids: Bringing Up Children in a Racially Unjust America” talk about religion and racism.
Charity of the week [Black Lives Matter.](http://www.blacklivesmatter.com)
Outro music by The Long Hunt https://thelonghunt.bandcamp.com

item.title: 163: Guns + Gorillas
item.itunes:title: Guns + Gorillas
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description:
Shane talks about guns, gorillas, and security with Assistant Professor of Psychology and author of “Don’t Overlook The Human.” Joel Suss, Ph.D.
Charity of the week: Exploration.org
Outro music by Spirit Of The Bear.

item.title: 162: Biodiversity + Speciation
item.itunes:title: Biodiversity + Speciation
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description:
Shane chats with Assistant Professor at The University of Oklahoma, Katharine Marske about phylogeography, biogeography, biodiversity and how these things relate to speciation. The Charity of the week is The National Parks Foundation.
Outro music by Sam Goodwill https://samgoodwill.bandcamp.com/
item.itunes:subtitle:
Shane chats with Assistant Professor at The University of Oklahoma, Katharine Marske about phylogeography, biogeography, biodiversity and how these things relate to speciation. The Charity of the week is The National Parks Foundation.
Outro music by ...
item.itunes:summary:
Shane chats with Assistant Professor at The University of Oklahoma, Katharine Marske about phylogeography, biogeography, biodiversity and how these things relate to speciation. The Charity of the week is The National Parks Foundation.
Outro music by Sam Goodwill https://samgoodwill.bandcamp.com/
item.content:encoded:
Shane chats with Assistant Professor at The University of Oklahoma, Katharine Marske about phylogeography, biogeography, biodiversity and how these things relate to speciation. The Charity of the week is The National Parks Foundation.

Outro music by Sam Goodwill https://samgoodwill.bandcamp.com/
item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: Dung Beetles + Recycling
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane talks with Entomologist Rachel Stone from Witchita State University about Dung Beetles, the tiny recyclers that live in the tiny world below our feet. Charity of the week: Expanding Your Horizons
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane talks with Entomologist Rachel Stone from Witchita State University about Dung Beetles, the tiny recyclers that live in the tiny world below our feet. Charity of the week: Expanding Your Horizons

item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: BioME
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane gets a tour of the futuristic BIoME lab at Wichita State University. The group explains the new medical sensor they are developing that has caught the attention of NASA. Hear how the lab is changing the future of medical imagining and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane gets a tour of the futuristic BIoME lab at Wichita State University. The group explains the new medical sensor they are developing that has caught the attention of NASA. Hear how the lab is changing the future of medical imagining and more.

item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: Space Exploration
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane has a far out conversation about space with Ph.D. James Schwartz: philosophy teacher at Wichita State University. They discuss the philosophy and ethics of space exploration. The charity of the week is The Planetary Society. "He’s Just A Protostar" performed by J Schwartz.

They discuss the philosophy and ethics of space exploration. The charity of the week is The Planetary Society. "He’s Just A Protostar" performed by J Schwartz.

item.title: Neuroplasticity + Addiction
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description:
PHD John Harkness, researcher and founder of Rewire Neuroscience, talks with Shane about Neuroplasticity, drug addiction, meth, mice and rats.
Outro music by The Long Hunt - https://thelonghunt.bandcamp.com/

item.title: The Wandering Mind
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane gets deep with PHD Student Brittany Alperin and talks about ADHD and the wandering mind through the lens of Psychology and Neuroscience. Outro music "Crucial Conversation" by Chrash. https://chrash1.bandcamp.com/releases

item.title: Intersectionality (Part 2)
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane talks with James A. Lindsay author of Everybody’s Wrong About God and outspoken atheist voice who holds degrees in physics and mathematics and writer & researcher Helen Pluckrose, known for her focus on the history of religion, ideology and narratives as well as postmodernism and intersectional feminism. Outro music by Tooth Lures A Fang.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane talks with James A. Lindsay author of Everybody’s Wrong About God and outspoken atheist voice who holds degrees in physics and mathematics and writer & researcher Helen Pluckrose, known for her focus on the history of religion, ideology and narra...

Lindsay author of Everybody’s Wrong About God and outspoken atheist voice who holds degrees in physics and mathematics and writer & researcher Helen Pluckrose, known for her focus on the history of religion, ideology and narratives as well as postmodernism and intersectional feminism. Outro music by Tooth Lures A Fang.
item.content:encoded: Shane talks with James A. Lindsay author of Everybody’s Wrong About God and outspoken atheist voice who holds degrees in physics and mathematics and writer & researcher Helen Pluckrose, known for her focus on the history of religion, ideology and narratives as well as postmodernism and intersectional feminism. Outro music by Tooth Lures A Fang.
item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: Medicine Hunting
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane talks psychedelics and medicine hunting with Chris Kilham, author, educator, and world-traveler researching and promoting plant-based medicines. He’s also the founder of Medicine Hunter, Inc. Outro music by Chrash.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane talks psychedelics and medicine hunting with Chris Kilham, author, educator, and world-traveler researching and promoting plant-based medicines. He’s also the founder of Medicine Hunter, Inc. Outro music by Chrash.

item.title: Happiness
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Cassie Mogilner Holmes, Associate Professor of marketing at UCLA’s Anderson School of Management, talks with Shane about happiness. Outro music by Chrash.

item.title: Awards + Incentives
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: This week, Shane talks in depth with Assistant Professor UCLA Anderson Strategy and Behavioral Decision Making, Jana Gallus. They get into awards, incentives, and all the things that motivate us. Outro music by Liv Carrow.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Shane talks in depth with Assistant Professor UCLA Anderson Strategy and Behavioral Decision Making, Jana Gallus. They get into awards, incentives, and all the things that motivate us. Outro music by Liv Carrow.

item.title: Intelligence + Hormones
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane welcomes back Professor at The University of California, author of "Hormonal: The Hidden Intelligence of Hormones" and the very first Here We Are podcast guest: Ph.D. Martie Haselton. Listen to them gab about hamsters, doggy mating, human estrus, and the intricacies of male and female hormones.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane welcomes back Professor at The University of California, author of "Hormonal: The Hidden Intelligence of Hormones" and the very first Here We Are podcast guest: Ph.D. Martie Haselton. Listen to them gab about hamsters, doggy mating, human estrus,...

Listen to them gab about hamsters, doggy mating, human estrus, and the intricacies of male and female hormones.
item.content:encoded: Shane welcomes back Professor at The University of California, author of "Hormonal: The Hidden Intelligence of Hormones" and the very first Here We Are podcast guest: Ph.D. Martie Haselton. Listen to them gab about hamsters, doggy mating, human estrus, and the intricacies of male and female hormones.
item.dc:creator: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio

item.title: Death + Telepathy
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Psilocybin Mushroom researcher, explorer, psychedelic facilitator and PhD Katherine MacLean talks with Shane about death, telepathy, and their shared experiences at mushroom retreats. Outro music by Coup De Grace.

item.title: Is Intersectionality a Religion?
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: Shane talks with author of "A Manual for Creating Atheists" creator of the Atheos App, and Assistant Professor of Philosophy at Portland State University Peter Boghossian. They discuss atheism, intersectionality, and the oppression matrix. Outro music by Archeress.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shane talks with author of "A Manual for Creating Atheists" creator of the Atheos App, and Assistant Professor of Philosophy at Portland State University Peter Boghossian. They discuss atheism, intersectionality, and the oppression matrix. Outro music ...

item.title: MDMA The Movie
item.itunes:author: Shane Mauss, Starburns Audio
item.description: In this special episode, Shane talks with founder of Dance Safe and director of MDMA The Movie Emanuel Sferios. Among many diverse topics like molly, harm reduction and ecstasy testing, they discuss using MDMA in a therapeutic setting. For more info, go to MDMAthemovie.com. Outro music by Sam Goodwill.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this special episode, Shane talks with founder of Dance Safe and director of MDMA The Movie Emanuel Sferios. Among many diverse topics like molly, harm reduction and ecstasy testing, they discuss using MDMA in a therapeutic setting. For more info, g...
